definition: whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating

sentences.english: The villagers beat drums and lit firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 村民們敲鑼打鼓放鞭炮。

sentences.english: We usually have the celebration with feasts and firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 我們通常以豐盛的閤家宴和鞭炮來慶祝新年。

sentences.english: The welcome ceremony appears extremely busy, has the orchestra to play music, the firecrackers fireworks sound together.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎儀式顯得熱鬧非凡，有樂隊奏樂，鞭炮禮花齊鳴。

sentences.english: People thought the banging and popping could help drive away evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 人們認爲鞭炮齊鳴能驅趕邪氣。

sentences.english: I also according to dad"s appearance set off firecrackers, just a little nervous."
sentences.chinese: 我也照父親的樣子放起鞭炮，只是有些緊張。

sentences.english: Many firecrackers hanging on walls in the daytime ready to send the coffin up the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 發殯那天村裏很多家門口都要掛上鞭炮送老人上山。

sentences.english: Third, set off firecrackers and the customs temporary enduring a tradition.
sentences.chinese: 第三，放鞭炮也是我國習俗傍邊經久不衰的一項傳統。

sentences.english: Many boys explode firecrackers on the Lantern Festival everyyear。
sentences.chinese: 許多男孩子每年在燈節放鞭炮。

sentences.english: They set off firecrackers and watch fireworks displays。
As he spoke, the sound of firecrackers punctuated the air.
sentences.chinese: 說着的時候，鞭炮的聲音破空而來。

sentences.english: I wanted to set off fireworks, but XiaoLing stopped me.
sentences.chinese: 我想要放鞭炮，但是曉玲組織了我。

sentences.english: We go out to see a lion and and set off some fireworks.
sentences.chinese: 我們出去看看舞龍獅和放鞭炮。

sentences.english: On the Eve of Chinese New Year, supper is a feast with families. The family will end the night with firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 除夕夜，家人會一起喫年夜飯，過年時會放鞭炮。

sentences.english: The more firecrackers, the more fortune and blessing.
sentences.chinese: 鞭炮放得越多，表示越多的財富和祝福。

sentences.english: We also enjoy making loud noise with firecrackers!
sentences.chinese: 我們也喜歡伴隨著吵雜的聲音燃放鞭炮。

sentences.english: Amid deafening applause, people on the platform went ashore in succession.
sentences.chinese: 在震耳欲聾的鞭炮聲中，試航人員依次上岸。

definition: firecrackers set off at the stroke of midnight on New Year's Day (a Chinese tradition)
sky lantern (miniature hot-air balloon used during festivals)
ritual money made of paper burnt for the Gods or the dead
joss paper made to resemble paper money
